post_text:
Even through a virtual presentation, the students of Plymouth had many teachers and staff in tears as their performance of this year‚Äôs theme was shared during Opening Day.

Dr. Maestas spoke on the theme of ‚Äúwe won‚Äôt give up,‚Äù and emphasized the responsibility we have as educators to continue to work together to ensure students feel supported and safe, all while providing a positive learning environment. No small feat!

Congratulations and THANK YOU to the over 75 remarkable students who took part in this outstanding performance. And a very special thank you to VPA Director, Mike Caple, and VPA educators, David Grossman and Jason Luciana, and EDTV.

Our teachers and staff are working diligently these upcoming weeks to prepare for a smooth transition to this new school year and we could not be more proud of the enthusiasm and positivity thus far. PPS students, we will not give up on you!

Our teachers and staff are working diligently these upcoming weeks to prepare for a smooth transition to this new school year and we could not be more proud of the enthusiasm and positivity thus far. PPS students, we will not give up on you!

post_text:
Get outside this weekend and enjoy a StoryWalk brought to you by Plymouth Family Network! ‚òÄÔ∏èüìö

Today through September 25th, take a beautiful walk through Tidmarsh Wildlife Sanctuary while enjoying Jeremy Tankard's "Grumpy Bird" along the way. Please use the QR code at the end to sign PFN's virtual guestbook or send us them email at pfn@plymouth.k12.ma.us.

*Tidmarsh is open to the public daily. Due to construction in the main parking lot of Tidmarsh, PFN will use the 100 Beaver Dam Road entrance. Please find the mailbox labeled "100." There is signage to direct you down the dirt road into the parking lot. Once there, you will see signs for the StoryWalk.

post_text:
Return-to-School Update

We have received many new transportation decisions since Tuesday of this week. Our staff is working diligently with First Student bus company to finalize bus routes. Families will be notified as soon as those become available.

Reminder: School administrators will be emailing start-of-school information to parents/guardians TOMORROW Friday, September 11th. Please check your primary email tomorrow.

All back-to-school questions can be directed to your child's school. Thank you for your patience as we work to get out as much information as possible these coming days.

post_text:
An important back-to-school update for our PPS families. We thank you so much for your patience. A few important items regarding back to school:

1. If you have not made a final decision regarding remote vs. hybrid please contact your child's school immediately as we are finalizing class assignment and transportation.

2. Bus routes will be finalized on Thursday, September 10th. They will be emailed to families and posted to our website at www.plymouth.k12.ma.us/ReturnToSchool.

3. Please check your primary email on Friday, September 11th for all start of school information.

All back-to-school questions can be directed to your child's school. We are truly looking forward to welcoming students back to our schools in just one week!

post_text:
Today we welcome our teachers and staff for the 2020-2021 school year. Each year, we begin with a very special Opening Day ceremony where Dr. Maestas sets the tone for the year, shares an inspiring message, and highlights a group of ever-deserving educators. This year marks Dr. Maestas‚Äô thirteenth Opening Day ceremony and his last as our Superintendent.

We invite you to join us this year as we hold Opening Day virtually! You‚Äôll hear from special guests, PPS administration, and meet new teachers and staff. Visit https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=o5AiafUvQcA to watch! The ceremony begins at 8:30 AM.

Welcome back teachers and staff! We are going to have a great year. üòä

post_text:
This week we welcomed new teachers to our school district. At a time of unpredictability, they have chosen to enter into one of the most selfless yet rewarding professions. We are so happy they chose Plymouth.

On Monday, they will join the rest of our dedicated teachers and staff as we begin the most challenging year in education.

PPS educators, you are exceptional AND essential. We will continue to work together to take on this far-from-normal year. Take care of yourselves, take care of your colleagues, reach out to your administration. We are here for you just as you are here for your students. Enjoy this last weekend of summer. ‚òÄÔ∏è We can't wait to see you on Monday.

To better assist you in your planning for your family, we have answered as many FAQ's as possible at this time and have posted them on our website. Please visit Plymouth.k12.ma.us/ReturnToSchool to learn more about our hybrid model, remote options, health and safety, technology, transportation, and more.

Please review the current FAQ's we have on our website and stay tuned for more information next week. We truly appreciate your support and patience during this time.

post_text:
We are pleased to announce that Mr. Erik Cioffi will be the Interim Assistant Superintendent for Human Resources while Mrs. Fry returns to Plymouth South High School as Principal for the 2020-21 school year.

Mr. Cioffi comes to us from Fannin High School in Georgia where he has served as Principal for the past 11 years. Prior to serving as Principal in Fannin County, Mr. Cioffi was an administrator for the Lee County School District for 10 years. Erik started his career as a biology Teacher. Mr. Cioffi has over 25 years of demonstrated success supporting students and staff and will undoubtedly be a great asset to our school community in the coming year. Originally from Massachusetts, Erik finds himself coming back home after many years.

While Mr. Cioffi's official start date will be September 1st, Erik has already begun and will continue his transition work with us over the next 6 weeks. Please join us in welcoming Mr. Erik Cioffi to the Plymouth Public Schools!
text:
We are pleased to announce that Mr. Erik Cioffi will be the Interim Assistant Superintendent for Human Resources while Mrs. Fry returns to Plymouth South High School as Principal for the 2020-21 school year.

Prior to serving as Principal in Fannin County, Mr. Cioffi was an administrator for the Lee County School District for 10 years. Erik started his career as a biology Teacher. Mr. Cioffi has over 25 years of demonstrated success supporting students and staff and will undoubtedly be a great asset to our school community in the coming year. Originally from Massachusetts, Erik finds himself coming back home after many years.

While Mr. Cioffi's official start date will be September 1st, Erik has already begun and will continue his transition work with us over the next 6 weeks. Please join us in welcoming Mr. Erik Cioffi to the Plymouth Public Schools!

post_text:
For families who have not done so already: we ask that you fill out our brief re-opening survey. The answers to this survey will provide us with guidance as we finalize plans for the re-opening of our schools.

**Please keep in mind, we understand answers to this survey may change depending on the final plans of re-entry. This survey focuses on your family's transportation plans so we can work on those details should we be in a face-to-face or hybrid model of learning in the fall. Please do not hesitate to leave a comment at the end of this survey. We truly appreciate and value your input.

We will continue to share information as it becomes available. As always, thank you for your patience as we work hard to formulate a plan that is safe for students and staff!

Visit https://www.smore.com/92txs for a copy of Dr. Maestas' most recent parent letter.

post_text:
Tune in to Boston 25 News tomorrow morning at 9:45 AM as ZipTrip features our COVID-19 Food Relief Program with our partners, South Shore Community Action Council, and the incredible volunteers who make it all happen.

This program could not be possible without the 40+ AMAZING individuals who have volunteered each week since March to fill over 7,800 bags of groceries and deliver them to families in need, including Plymouth Center for Active Living. They are our school nurse educators, teachers, staff, parents, and community members and they have all made a world of a difference during these trying times. ‚ù§Ô∏è THANK YOU, THANK YOU, THANK YOU! Be sure to tune in tomorrow morning!

post_text:
Friendly reminder! Our Food Services is serving FREE breakfast and lunch for children 18 and under all summer long. Monday through Friday, 11:00 - 1:00 PM, at Hedge Elementary School and Indian Brook Elementary School.

No registration or identification required. Meals are Grab & Go. Please be sure to wear a face covering.

In addition to HES and IBES, the Summer Food Service Program is also available at the Boys & Girls Club, Camp Clark, the summer school program at Plymouth Community Intermediate School and the Algonquin heights community.

A very special THANK YOU to the women and men of PPS Food Services!

post_text:
Parents and guardians,

Please take a moment to read the attached letter from Dr. Maestas that was emailed to families earlier this afternoon. Included is an update on our reopening plan for the Plymouth Public Schools for the 2020-2021 school year, Massachusetts Department of Elementary and Secondary Education (DESE) guidance, and a brief yet helpful survey as we continue to finalize our reopening plan.

We will continue to share information with you on how the school district will proceed to start the school year as it becomes available. As always, thank you for your patience during this time. We hope you are enjoying your summer!

post_text:
Camp Invention, although looked a little different this year, provided the same exciting, hands-on experience as in years past. Last week students received four themed kits providing all the materials needed to create, investigate, and problem-solve.

Students learned about principles of flight, going outdoors to experiment with paper planes and hand-copters. They explored bioluminescence as they used LEDs to create glowing flowers. With the Design Thinking Kit, students came up with innovative products to solve everyday problems - like a book grip to prevent a book from sliding from your hand when reading. Great idea, Charlotte!

They built the ultimate sports complex, reprogrammed robots, and learned ways to protect the Earth‚Äôs ecosystems. Our dedicated Camp Invention Coaches and PPS educators were on hand to virtually connect, collaborate, and answer students' questions.

Thank you Ms. Lavin and Ms. Hapgood for another wonderful summer of Camp Invention! üòé

Plymouth Public Schools STE

Camp Invention, although looked a little different this year, provided the same exciting, hands-on experience as in years past. Last week students received four themed kits providing all the materials needed to create, investigate, and problem-solve.

Students learned about principles of flight, going outdoors to experiment with paper planes and hand-copters. They explored bioluminescence as they used LEDs to create glowing flowers. With the Design Thinking Kit, students came up with innovative products to solve everyday problems - like a book grip to prevent a book from sliding from your hand when reading. Great idea, Charlotte!

They built the ultimate sports complex, reprogrammed robots, and learned ways to protect the Earth‚Äôs ecosystems. Our dedicated Camp Invention Coaches and PPS educators were on hand to virtually connect, collaborate, and answer students' questions.

Thank you Ms. Lavin and Ms. Hapgood for another wonderful summer of Camp Invention! üòé

post_text: There really are no words of comfort for this type of loss. We send our deepest condolences to the Robinson family. ‚ù§Ô∏è
shared_text:
Plymouth Public Schools Visual & Performing Arts
July 9 at 2:12 PM ¬∑

We are devastated by the recent loss to our VPA community. This loss has hit us hard. Kyle Robinson, PNHS Class of 2017, was a positive, kind, and talented member of VPA and the Plymouth Public Schools. There are countless stories and memories we all have of Kyle and we urge you to keep sharing them. We are truly grateful for the unforgettable moments he shared with us on and off the stage.

Our thoughts and prayers go out to his family during this time of loss and grief. With permission from the family, we share with you the following information - https://www.bartlett1620.com/memorials/kyle-robinson/4258282/index.php.

Plymouth EDTV wasn't able to host their tradition summer camp this year but that hasn't stopped them from providing lots of engaging challenges for students to have fun and keep their video skills sharp all summer long.

New challenges will be released weekly in which they will explore some of the more elaborate areas of film production. These challenges are open to all grades and skill levels.

If you‚Äôre a Plymouth resident in grades K-12 you are welcome and encouraged to participate!! Visit plymouthedtv.com/virtual for more information on how to borrow a camera and equipment and to get started!

Our free lunch program will continue throughout the summer at two locations - Hedge Elementary School and Indian Brook Elementary School.

Children 18 and under can enjoy free meals all summer long. The Summer Food Service Program is a safe, fun way for children to get nutritious meals when school is not in session. No registration or identification required.

Meals are Grab & Go. Please be sure to wear a face covering.
